description: Independent Peer Review Services for the management of contaminated sites in the North, including the Yukon and the Northwest Territories. The successful supplier shall provide expert independent peer review and advice to enhance project proposals and approaches to support project planning and monitoring of project execution.

full_summary:
# Independent Peer Review Services

## Tender Announcement

The Department of Crown-Indigenous Relations and Northern Affairs (CIRNA) intends to award a four-year contract for Independent Peer Review Services to a pre-selected supplier. The services will be used to provide expert technical evaluation, support, and advice on studies, plans, and projects related to mine closure and environmental management.

## Background

The CIRNA has a requirement for Independent Peer Review Services to support the management of Contaminated Sites in the North. The goal is to ensure that these sites are assessed, cared for, and remediated in a cost-effective and consistent manner. The Northern Contaminated Sites Branch (NCSB) is responsible for managing a portfolio of abandoned mine sites in the Northwest Territories and Yukon.

## Scope of Work

The Independent Peer Review Services will include:

* Expert technical evaluation and support on studies, plans, and projects
* Review and assessment of project proposals, remediation plans, and detailed work plans
* Identification and prioritization of strategic, technical, or operational risks
* Analysis of topics within required Technical Subject Matter Areas

## Required Qualifications

To be considered, respondents must demonstrate that they meet the following requirements:

* An established professional firm with experience in providing a breadth of expert advisory services
* A team of qualified Resources across all 12 required Technical Subject Matter Areas
* Experience in providing independent review and technical advisory services for complex mining construction projects or Mine Closure construction projects
* Ability to provide reliable service from a dedicated team of at least 10 qualified Technical Subject Matter Expert Resources

## Submission Information

The closing date for submissions is February 15, 2024. Responses must be in writing to the contact person identified in the notice. The notice number is 1000253902.

## Procurement Process

This procurement is subject to the Canada Free Trade Agreement and the Canada-European Union – Comprehensive Economic Trade Agreement.

Note: All applicable trade agreements and comprehensive land claims agreements are listed in the original text but not included in the above rewritten entry.

I made the following changes to the original text:

* Broke up long paragraphs into smaller ones
* Removed redundant or unnecessary information
* Rephrased sentences for better clarity and grammar
* Removed the contractor's special features and exceptions
* Rephrased the requirements for the respondents to be more concise
* Removed non-essential information about the contract and the respondent's company
* Included a clear and concise summary of the scope of work and the required qualifications for respondents
